On simple shots he shoots 4 pellets

On criticals he shoots 6 pellets.

To hit all those pellets he needs to be in melle range.

If we count in the extra shot given by the dash, he has 3 shots.

If all shots are non-crits - the cooldown is reduced by 6 seconds. Making the cooldown 5.2 seconds.

If all shots are crits the cooldown is reduced by 9 seconds. Making the cooldown 2.2 seconds.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Be in melle range for 3 shots.
2. Have time for 3 shots.
3. Hit all the shots.
4. Get criticals on every shot.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I assure you in jungle clearing + traversing through river + in team fights  + base movement speed Graves out shines her in mobility at all stages.


Even in late game, Kindred, during a fight can hop approximately 3 times at a limited distance in one specific area. Which then goes on a fairly long CD. Until those cds are up, she's statistically less mobile than almost all other champs in regards to dashing. 

Graves is not set by those limitations.  

Graves also lowers his dash cd by 2 seconds per non crit, and 3 seconds with crits.

At 40% cdr, which Graves can readily get.  Graves resets his dash in 2/3 attacks. And since the dash resets his attack timer, it's actually faster than one would think. 

The only time Kindred has "more mobility" is when she's hopping back and forth in a very particular zone for a very brief amount of time, and isn't really actually doing anything besides spitting out 150 damage and reset an auto.  And even then, Graves can achieve the same mobility she can in that particular instance. 

So with that concluded, the only time Kindred has "more mobility" is walking back from base. But even then, remember, she has way lower base ms. So, all those dashes do is "replace" the speed Graves already has passively walking.  But even then, with that said, Graves can dash and just displace that anyways. 

Please note, this also isn't even taking into effect for the special snowflake Graves that take Storm Raiders.

Kindred is overbearing? On what server?

they also fall off in late game where (as a infinte scaling personifaction of death itself) they actually should succeed more. 

That dueling is awesome but the fact that they aren't really scalibg into late game bothers me.

I like the chance-based scaling of kindred, though!

It is kinda cool that we have a champion that is flat-out strong early, and based on how well you play early to mid determines how well you scale into lategame. It is a scaling / snowball mechanic that depends on player skill and awareness outside of just earning gold from kills and farm. You have to get the right kills, and get the right farm to get that scaling. When i see a kindred that has 10 stacks at 20 minutes and DIDNT get 4 scuttle marks in a row, im like DAMN, props to u u played that shit well.

What I do not like is that a failure to snowball into a big lategame is not severaly punished like it is for Yi or other scaling-potential champs, as you can always just play for the defensive ult and swap out for green smite if you fall behind.

A super-snowballer with a very strong early game is pretty contrary to the design philosophy we see with other champs who snowball particularly hard. 

Imagine if Katarina was strong early and won almost every lane while still snowballing super hard with gold. The rationale that Kindred's influence falls off hard late game applies equally to Katarina. Kat hits her high point in the early mid game after hitting 30 spell pen and finishing Luden's or Gunblade as first item. 

Once people start finishing their MR items/Maws, Kat's threat level drops and her risk level spikes despite the fact that she continues to scale well into late. As a practical matter, she falls off like Kindred despite actual late-game scaling.

With the same snowball design and late game circumstances, why is Kindred allowed to have an OP early game and easy snowball while Kat is intentionally designed to lose basically every lane against an equal opponent?

kindred isn't super strong early anymore though, and lacks the play making ability of real early game powerhouses like lee/elise/nidalee to force the fights they want. They're more centered around mid game and objective control.
